etymology.interpretation: Emphasizes refusing new clutter, discarding excess, and detaching from attachment to possessions. Promotes a mindful, minimalist lifestyle born from the principle of reduction.
etymology.simplification: 斷→断与離→离通过减笔与整字简化降低笔画；捨→舍以现成的“舍”兼任“捨”的写法以统一并简便书写，整体提高书写与印刷效率。

examples.chinese: 我最近在练习断舍离(我最近在練習斷捨離)，清掉了很多旧衣服(清掉了很多舊衣服)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zuìjìn zài liànxí duànshělí, qīng diàole hěn duō jiù yīfú.
examples.english: I’ve been practicing decluttering recently and cleared out many old clothes.

examples.chinese: 断是拒绝不需要的东西(斷是拒絕不需要的東西)，舍是丢弃多余物品(捨是丟棄多餘物品)，离是从执念中抽离(離是從執念中抽離)。
examples.pinyin: Duàn shì jùjué bù xūyào de dōngxī, shě shì diūqì duōyú wùpǐn, lí shì cóng zhíniàn zhōng chōulí.
examples.english: Duan means refusing what isn’t needed, She means discarding excess items, and Li means detaching from fixation.

examples.chinese: 通过断舍离(通過斷捨離)，我的房间变得更清爽(我的房間變得更清爽)，也更容易打扫(也更容易打掃)。
examples.pinyin: Tōngguò duànshělí, wǒ de fángjiān biàn de gèng qīngshuǎng, yě gèng róngyì dǎsǎo.
examples.english: Through Danshari, my room became fresher and easier to clean.
